title: Create the Gapminder dataset
text:
# Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd
from gapminder import gapminder

# Rename 'lifeExp' to 'life_expectancy' and 'gdpPercap' to 'gdp_per_capita'
gapminder = gapminder.rename(columns={'lifeExp': 'life_expectancy',
                                      'pop': 'population_millions', 
                                      'gdpPercap': 'gdp_per_capita'})

# Convert population to millions
gapminder['population_millions'] = gapminder['population_millions'] / 1_000_000

# Create a new pandas DataFrame from the modified gapminder data
gapminder_df = pd.DataFrame(gapminder)

# Save the DataFrame as a CSV file
gapminder_df.to_csv('gapminder.csv', index=False)

# Print the first 3 rows of the DataFrame
print(gapminder_df.head(3))

       country continent  year  life_expectancy  population_millions  \
0  Afghanistan      Asia  1952           28.801             8.425333   
1  Afghanistan      Asia  1957           30.332             9.240934   
2  Afghanistan      Asia  1962           31.997            10.267083   

   gdp_per_capita  
0      779.445314  
1      820.853030  
2      853.100710

title: Interactive Global Map
text:
The map below illustrates life expectancy across the globe. You can hover over individual countries to see their specific data, or use the slider at the bottom to watch how life expectancy has evolved worldwide from 1952 to 2007.

import pandas as pd
import plotly.express as px

# Load the dataset
gapminder = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

# Create the interactive choropleth map
fig = px.choropleth(
    gapminder,
    locations="country",
    locationmode="country names", # Tells Plotly to match our country column to its internal map
    color="life_expectancy",
    hover_name="country",
    animation_frame="year",       # Adds a time slider!
    color_continuous_scale=px.colors.sequential.Plasma,
    title="Global Life Expectancy (1952-2007)",
    range_color=[30, 85]          # Sets a fixed color scale for the animation
)

# Update layout for a cleaner look
fig.update_layout(
    geo=dict(showframe=False, showcoastlines=True, projection_type='equirectangular'),
    margin={"r":0,"t":40,"l":0,"b":0}
)

# Display the map
fig.show()

title: Country Analysis
text: This page explores how life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population have evolved in the United states

title: Country Analysis
text: This page explores how life expectancy, GDP per capita, and population have evolved in the United states

title: Country Analysis
text:
Analysis

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Load the dataset
gapminder = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

# Filter the data for the United States
us_data = gapminder[gapminder['country'] == 'United States']

# Set up the matplotlib figure with 3 subplots sharing the x-axis
fig, axes = plt.subplots(3, 1, figsize=(10, 12), sharex=True)
sns.set_theme(style="whitegrid")

# Plot 1: Life Expectancy over time
sns.lineplot(
    ax=axes[0], data=us_data, x="year", y="life_expectancy", 
    marker="o", color="mediumblue", linewidth=2
)
axes[0].set_title("Life Expectancy (Years)", fontsize=12)
axes[0].set_ylabel("")

# Plot 2: GDP per Capita over time
sns.lineplot(
    ax=axes[1], data=us_data, x="year", y="gdp_per_capita", 
    marker="o", color="forestgreen", linewidth=2
)
axes[1].set_title("GDP per Capita ($)", fontsize=12)
axes[1].set_ylabel("")

# Plot 3: Population over time
sns.lineplot(
    ax=axes[2], data=us_data, x="year", y="population_millions", 
    marker="o", color="darkred", linewidth=2
)
axes[2].set_title("Population (Millions)", fontsize=12)
axes[2].set_ylabel("")
axes[2].set_xlabel("Year", fontsize=12)

# Adjust layout to prevent overlapping
plt.tight_layout()
plt.suptitle("United States Development Trends (1952 - 2007)", y=1.03, fontsize=16)

# Display the plot
plt.show()








It is evident that all three metrics have steadily increased with time.

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text: This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita.

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text: This page explores the relationship between life expectancy and GDP per capita.

title: Life Expectancy and GDP per Capita
text:
Analysis

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Load the dataset
gapminder = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

# Set the visual style
sns.set_theme(style="whitegrid")

# Create the scatter plot
plt.figure(figsize=(9, 6))
sns.scatterplot(
    data=gapminder, 
    x="gdp_per_capita", 
    y="life_expectancy", 
    hue="continent", 
    alpha=0.7,
    palette="viridis"
)



# Add labels and title
plt.title("Life Expectancy vs. GDP per Capita (1952-2007)", fontsize=14)
plt.xlabel("GDP per Capita", fontsize=12)
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy (Years)", fontsize=12)

# Display the plot
plt.show()

title: Life Expectancy and Population
text:
Analysis

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Load the dataset
gapminder = pd.read_csv("gapminder.csv")

# Set the visual style
sns.set_theme(style="whitegrid")

# Create the scatter plot
plt.figure(figsize=(9, 6))
sns.scatterplot(
    data=gapminder, 
    x="population_millions", 
    y="life_expectancy", 
    hue="continent", 
    alpha=0.6,
    palette="magma"
)


# Add labels and title
plt.title("Life Expectancy vs. Population (1952-2007)", fontsize=14)
plt.xlabel("Population in Millions", fontsize=12)
plt.ylabel("Life Expectancy (Years)", fontsize=12)

# Display the plot
plt.show()
